name: Meher
bio:
I am a 9-year-old who loves robotics. I am in 4th grade at Creekside Elementary School in Sammamish. I love being part of my robotics team because it gives me a chance to be creative, solve real world problems, while having fun with my teammates and friends.
Some of my favorite parts of robotics are coding, adding onto attachments, and helping with the Innovation Project. I enjoy thinking outside the box and finding new ways to improve our robot or our team's ideas. Whether I’m programming or putting together pieces.
When I’m not doing robotics, I love to read and write stories, play with my friends and animals (especially dogs and cats!) My friends and I enjoy building safe homes in the wilderness for wild animals. We also spend time outside exploring nature. I enjoy dancing—especially contemporary and hip-hop. I love basketball as well! I am on the Skyline girls basketball team.
I am always excited to learn, create, and challenge myself both inside and outside of robotics.

name: Aradhya
bio:
Aradhya writes the control code and tunes sensors.
They develop reusable routines for navigation and manipulation.
Aradhya enjoys debugging and optimizing algorithms.
They also help document our team's design decisions.
When not coding, Aradhya likes math puzzles and chess.

name: Avinash
bio:
Avinash researches the project topic and prepares presentations.
They coordinate team outreach and demonstrations.
Avinash helps with strategy and mission planning.
They practice speaking and visual storytelling for events.
Outside of FLL, Avinash enjoys photography and reading.
